p: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle King County
In the matter of the application of Qui (a Chinaman) for a writ of habeas corpus
the Hon. Roger S Greene Judge of King County
The petition of Qui a Chinaman, respectfully shows
1. That he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by John H McGraw Sheriff of King County, Washington Territory.
2. That said imprisonment, detention confinement and restraint are illegal; and that said illegality consists in this to wit:

That in the 17th day of November 1884 at Port Madison in Kitsap County before Harry C Hale a Justice of the Peace in and for Port Madison Precinct in Kitsap County a complaint was filed made before said Justice, by name (NEW PAGE) to your petitioner unknown whereby your petitioner was charged with the alleged offense of smoking and inhaling opium on said County on the _ day of November 1884

That when said complaint a warrant was issued by said Justice upon which warrant your petitioner was arrested and brought before said Justice; that then after such proceedings were had in said complaint that on the said 17 day of November your petitioner was tried before said Justice for said alleged offense and after such trial your petitioner was found guilty of said alleged offense and was by the Judgment of said Court sentenced to imprisonment, for the period of sixteen days

That therefore said Justice Court issued its warrant of commitment, a true copy of which is annexed to this petition marked Exhibit "A" and in- tending to act under such warrant of Commitment, the Sheriff of Kitsap County bbrought your petitionerto the County Jail of King County and then on the said 17th day of November 1884 delivered him unto the custody of the said John H McGraw Sheriff of King County, who will detain him in (NEW PAGE) custody and restrain him from his liberty, having an other authority or pretext san and said writ of Commitment

That said trial and commitment were had, led by virtue of Section 2073 of this Code of Washington; that said Section is unconstitutional and void and that said commitment and trial are without authority of law; that the said complaint against your petitioner charges no defense; and said Justice had no power or jurisdiction to render said judgment of imprisonment

Wherefor your petitioner prays, that a writ of habeas corpus may issue to said John H McGraw Sheriff of King County, commanding him to have the body of your petitioner before your Honor at a time and place therein with sferisseid, to do and receive what shall then and there be ordered concerning him, together with the time and cause of his detention and said writ and that your petitioner may be restored of his liberty
Dated Nov 18, 1884 Qui his signature Steven Merris + M Mricken Attys for petitioner
